Thank you Coleen for a wonderful experience. Six adults (including two grandmothers both over 80!!) enjoyed his three-floor home that was both intimate and spacious.
The kitchen was well-provisioned, including delicious organic coffee that Coleen had left for us to enjoy. Since we ate two breakfasts and two dinners at the house, we were able to take full advantage of the house. All bedrooms were very comfortable and we all slept very well. The bathroom had great amenities and many huge cotton towels.
We enjoyed the TV and large dining table to play games at night. The hot tub was a treat for some in our party. The second-floor porch was a welcome retreat to ease into the morning.
Coleen checked in with us multiple times. Her directions for check-out were clear and concise.
We are so grateful for our fabulous weekend to celebrate my son's college graduation from Orono. If we ever have the occasion to stay in Bangor again, we would happily return to stay at Coleen's bungalow.

The grill fire pit and hot tub were an awesome added bonus for my family gave us time something to wind down and do at night. The hot tub was a little funky by the time we left and there were no instructions on cleaning or maintaining while we were there but that’s partly on me for not reaching out. All in all it was an amazing place to stay and we would happily stay again on our next visit! Great place and a great value!

A small, lovely place with a nice fire pit in the backyard. Quiet neighborhood close from the highway. Kind of far from Acadia if that's where you're headed to. Might not be ideal if you like to sleep in on your vacation, or don't like cold and wet weather.
About the house:
Maine is extremely humid in summer (we went in early October and it was still super humid). That cold and humidity is only magnified by the fact that this house is in (yes, in) a hill. The first floor is semi underground and was cold and wet. When I first arrived and sat on the mattress, it felt as if it was full of water (not literally full, but it had a lot of water in it for sure). But this is not a problem on the second and third floor which are above ground level. If you have fewer than 4 guests, you won't need to sleep on the first floor.
The second floor is the main living room, dining room, kitchen and balcony, which are all super lovely, well functional, and what we enjoyed the most during our stay.
The third floor has 2 more bedrooms which are dry and comfy. Room is a bit limited with the A-shape roof.
There is a fire pit, gas BBQ grill and nice hot tub in the yard. You need to buy your own fire starter and log. We got it from a nearby supermarket and enjoyed a nice fireside chat.
About the experience:
Everything was great until checkout. We enjoyed the fireside chat so much that the next morning we didn't wake up until 10AM. Checkout was at 11AM. The cleaning lady arrived when we were just finishing brunch. She said she could start in the bedrooms while we cleaned things up in the kitchen, so that's what we did. But our host was not happy that we checked out 1 hour late, and there was some strong wording in the message I received.
From the hosts' standpoint, I understand that since there is only one property, if they need to get it ready for another guest to check in by 3PM on the same day, then they need to start at 11AM or sometimes even 10AM sharp. I would agree with our host that it was, quoting the message, "truly an inconvenience to our staff and the next guest".
Meanwhile from a guest's standpoint, especially someone who would like to have the flexibility to sleep in a little bit on vacation, I find that hotels generally offer much better flexibility with regard to late checkout unless they're literally fully booked.
I definitely could have done a better job communicating to the host that we needed late checkout, or I could have risen a bit earlier to avoid creating the inconvenience; but still, I fail to see how it's a critical problem when the cleaning lady was able to start her job at 11AM as expected.
Overall the checkout experience felt like an exam: you should be out promptly, you should adhere to all of the instructions, or you're a failed guest. The message I received was that I checked out 1 hr late, I forgot to register the 2 additional guests who ended up joining me in my trip (drove 10 hrs straight, too tired and forgot to add them), and after I drove away I realized my friend forgot to start the dishwasher after loading it. So in summary, I'm probably a terribly failed guest?
I felt aweful about it. It definitely wasn't my intention to bring others inconvenience, but oh well, sometimes we slip. I offered our host to pay late checkout fee as well as additional cleaning fee. I hope it could at least partially compensate for my imperfect performance as a guest, but next time I take a vacation, I definitely won't be looking to give myself such a rigorous "perfect guest test". I'm not a perfect guest, or a perfect persion by any measure, and I'd appreciate some room to be on the chill side on my vacation; it does not work very well in situations with low tolerance for error like this one.

Lloyd's place had both "pros" and a few concerns.
Pros:
- it was immaculate! So very, very clean!
- it was delightfully spacious
- the place was very well appointed
- we cooked two meals; the kitchen was well equipped
- the decor was lovely
- beds were comfortable
- communications were proactive & helpful
- for us, the location was great
Concerns include:
- in the house instructions, we were asked to bring the trash to the dumpster. I don't mean to sound privileged. Disposing of trash is not beneath me. When on vacation, and when spending $197.78 for one night, INCLUDING cleaning fee, I would hope that the cleaning person would take care of the trash.
- in 3 places, we were asked to give a five star review (if we enjoyed our stay), the guest book, an information sheet and digital messages from Lloyd
- if you are sensitive, beware of the strong laundry detergent used on the sheets
- due to a/c units windows don't open in some rooms
Overall, I do recommend this place to stay.

review_text:
Planned to stay for a long weekend to move our son in to UMaine. The goods:
Location! so close to downtown Bangor and all the coffee, food, shops you need while traveling. Also a short drive to Orono campus. All around convenient for that task.
Pet friendly: I cannot say enough how grateful I am when hosts allow dogs. We have a geriatric dog who cannot be left when we travel and I take great care to ensure we never leave a mess but it is difficult to find hotels and rentals that allow dogs. I am always immensely grateful to find a host who trusts enough to allow my dog to come along.
I was happy to see the list of cleaning requests for check out was optional/if you have time. When being charged a cleaning fee I really hate to have to clean before I leave and it seems they understand that when some hosts do not.
We did not use the kitchen or dining table, we went out for all meals.
The room- for -improvements:
Safety: I do think the code should change from guest to guest. It was really scary to think every person had the same, very insecure code to get into that house. Most places use the last 4 digits of your phone number so it feels pretty secure yet easy to remember. It was harder to get on the Wifi than in the door.
Comfort: Don't get me wrong, the home is cute. It just wasn't particularly furnished for the comforts I find necessary when travelling. I look for a comfy couch to relax after a long day of running around and a comfy bed to get a refreshing sleep. We found the beds/pillows to be really uncomfortable. I think the bed frame was a little unstable and every minor movement shook the whole bed. It was almost like being on a cot. The neighbors flood light was on all night and shining right into the bedroom. There is no shade or blind but just a curtain and it was a struggle to keep the curtain closed enough to try to block the light but also allow air from the window ac unit. I literally did not sleep at all the first night. I see that others have commented on the comfort of the bed and liking it so maybe I am too sensitive. We did depart a day early because I just really needed to sleep.

review_text:
Okay: for full disclosure, the only reason Erik's stylish, comfortable home didn't get five stars all across is the location. We were in a bind during a visit to family in Orono, and it was not walking distance (certainly that's all on us for not booking sooner), but what the location has is a great pocket park within a short walk, the gorgeous river nearby, friendly neighbors, quiet, peace, and a great big fenced yard and garden.
Erik's place was as advertised. It looks like an older structure, perhaps, but it's been thoroughly updated. There's power wherever you want it, all the kitchen gear you're likely to need. The living/sitting room is pretty darn wonderful. We were stupidly lucky enough to arrive during the closing days of the Tour de France. We're huge fans, and plugging the laptop into the GIANT TV gave us front row seats night after night. Which also meant we did not spend enough time in the comfortable bed.
There's a small back deck off the master bedroom, and it's perfect for breakfast or lunch, watching the squirrels and birds doing their thing. In short, we loved it!
Erik was very accommodating about an early check-in to drop our luggage. No intrusions, just a solid confidence that if we needed anything, it would be handled ASAP.
